English Text: Learn about the different types of rocks, their formation, and how to identify them in the wild.
Formed through the cooling and solidification of magma or lava. Examples include granite, basalt, and obsidian.
Formed by the deposition and cementation of mineral or organic particles. Examples include sandstone, limestone, and shale.
Formed when existing rocks are subjected to heat and pressure causing physical or chemical changes. Examples include marble, slate, and quartzite.
Look at the texture: Is it coarse or fine-grained?
Check the color: Different minerals create different colors
Test hardness: Can it scratch glass or be scratched by a knife?
Observe patterns: Look for layers, bands, or crystals
Consider weight: Some rocks are denser than others
Use the camera tab to identify rocks in the wild!

Forms in volcanic rocks when gas cavities become lined with crystals
Ancient Greeks believed amethyst prevented intoxication and wore it as protection
Forms in pegmatite deposits through slow cooling of magma
Known as the "love stone" and has been used in love rituals for over 6,000 years
